etymology.interpretation: Combines the act of issuing with a slip/document to denote an officially issued bill or receipt. Commonly refers to tax-valid invoices used for reimbursement and accounting.
etymology.simplification: 發→发 to reduce strokes via a cursive-derived form; 票 unchanged.

parts.english: to issue; to send out; to emit; to develop

examples.chinese: 请开一张发票(請開一張發票)。
我丢了昨天的发票(我丟了昨天的發票)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ diū le zuótiān de fāpiào.

examples.chinese: 报销需要正规发票(報銷需要正規發票)。
